stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the session chasing a persistent crash in Return to Yoshi’s Island, finishes basic UV-mapping for wall textures, and then switches to designing the Course 13 “8-bit pipe” retro stage. After debating submarines and standard platforming, he locks in a black-and-white, forced-perspective plane shooter based on Super Mario Land 1 World 4-3.

development_findings.summary: Crash source traced to invalid coin-formation objects (e.g. at X-coords –5008, –6651). Removing those objects stops the level from hard-crashing.
development_findings.quote: I bet it's one of those coin formations here crashing.

development_findings.summary: Retro stage decision: a 60 FPS, on-rails plane shooter in black & white, camera locked head-on. Uses a 3D voxel-style Mario plane and simple 3D enemy models, replicating Super Mario Land 1 – 4-3.
development_findings.quote: Yes, it being Land 1 is non-negotiable.

development_findings.summary: Play-area will be visually bounded by textured borders; fog will be added to avoid showing the entire corridor at once.
Prototype plane model built in-stream (≈420 triangles); entire front half deleted to save polys because it is never visible.
Only Project64 + GlideN64 will be officially supported; Kaze refuses to target Parallel or other emulators due to bug-workarounds and usability costs.
development_findings.quote: Every emulator is broken as fuck… I just have to pick one emulator and run with it.

development_findings.summary: Uses the N64 Expansion Pak and plans to keep the retro shooter at 60 FPS.
Long-term performance idea (hypothetical): rewriting the original graph-render code to fit one cache block would let the base game hit 30 FPS and make adding Luigi trivial.
development_findings.quote: The first thing I do is fix the graph render code… and now the entire game runs at 30 FPS.

development_findings.summary: Upgrader / Fast64 workflow tweaks: Lilaa guides Kaze to ‘check for update and install main’; Kaze preparing a pull-request to improve the Upgrader UI so others don’t misuse it.

context_findings.summary: Parents are visiting Germany for 10 days; Kaze spent several hours setting up an automatic lawn-mower before stream.
He received ~15 new Yoshi plushies from his parents; collection is visible on camera.
He plans to stream nearly every day to increase income, claiming he is highly productive while live.
context_findings.quote: I need to work more because I want to make more money, so that's why I'm going to just stream basically every day now.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on toolchain: pick one emulator, master its quirks, and avoid spreading effort across multiple broken tools.

biobak.summary: Suggested alternative retro ideas, confirmed that a black-and-white aesthetic would still look good, and renamed draw-layer enums to match engine expectations.

key_stories.title: Coin-Formation Crash Hunt
key_stories.summary: A mysterious level crash persists despite removing collision triangles. Kaze suspects coin formations, deletes specific instances, and the game finally boots.
key_stories.process: Tried collision fixes, then isolated actors and scanned coordinates until suspect formations were found and removed.
key_stories.key_quote: Yeah, it is one of the coin formations.

key_stories.title: Choosing the Super Mario Land 1 Plane Level
key_stories.summary: Course 13 needed an 8-bit section. After rejecting deserts and submarines, Kaze—and chat—agree on the iconic plane stage from SML1. Constraints (pre-1996 games) and aesthetic goals guide the decision.
key_stories.challenge: Find a retro concept that is nostalgic yet mechanically fresh.
key_stories.process: Brainstorming multiple SML1 areas, weighing gameplay translation effort, sprite requirements, and uniqueness.
key_stories.outcome: Locked in a forced-perspective shooter; implementation details sketched in stream.
key_stories.key_quote: I want them to be like all platforming… but yes, it being Land 1 is non-negotiable.
